results.title: Un officier de police sans importance = A police officer without importance
results.creator_credit: Jean Larriaga, Daniel Moosmann and Philippe Ogouz
results.brief_description:
In order to help free his brother from jail, Pierre organises the kidnapping of a police officer to serve as hostage and bargaining chip.

Credits: Producer, Daniel Moosman, Philippe Ogouz ; director, Jean Larriaga ; writers, Jean Larriaga, Marc Porel ; photography, Roland Dantigny ; music, Laurent Petitgirard.
Cast: Marc Porel, Robert Hossein, Jean Negulesco, Dani, Charles Denner.

results.title: L'acrobate = the Acrobat
results.creator_credit: Jean-Daniel Pollet, Ilios Films and Les Films du Chef-Lieu
results.brief_description:
Leon, an often bullied bathhouse attendant, is too timid to get a date and must often share his nights and dreams with the local working girls. He is truly in love with one of them and does not quite know how to declare his passion. Leon decides to take up tango lesson. As Leon’s footwork improves on the dance floor, so does his ability to approach women. Awards: Prix de la Critique. Festival du Film d’Humour, Chamrousse 1976

Credits: Director, Jean-Daniel Pollet ; writers, Jean-Daniel Pollet, Jacques Lourcelles.
Cast: Claude Melki, Guy Marchand, Marion Game, Micheline Dax, Laurence Bru, Edith Scob.

results.title: La Sentence = the Sentence
results.brief_description:
In September 1944, four resistance fighters and a fisherman are captured by German soldiers after a failed grenade attack. They are taken to the basement of a deserted house while awaiting their fate. They are to be executed in the morning.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Jean Valere ; writers, Georges-Jan Arnaud, Marcel Moussy, Jean Valere ; photography, Henri Decae ; music, Daniel Lesur ; art direction, Bernard Evein, Jacques Saulnier.
Cast: Robert Hossein, Marina Vlady, Roger Hanin, Beatrice Bretty, Lucien Raimbourg.

results.title: Lacombe, Lucien
results.brief_description:
Lucien Lacombe, an apolitical country boy refused by the Resistance, becomes a collaborator hunting down and torturing people for the Gestapo. What made Lacombe Lucien so strong and what made the controversy somewhat a series of misunderstandings is that in its description of characters and events the film exposes all the ambiguities and contradictions in behaviour that belonged to that period. For instance, in this part of France where Resistance and collaboration were facts of life, the film was completely accepted. People who had lived through that period knew that this film was completely true and honest about what actually happened. And people who were not French took it for what it was: a reflection on the nature of evil. The controversy was between French intellectuals and politicians. Those who attacked the film did it on the grounds that it was fiction; we had invented and put on screen a character who was complex and ambiguous to the point where his behaviour was acceptable. For them, it justified collaboration - which certainly is not what I was trying to do.” Reference: Philip French. Malle on Malle.

Credits: Director, Louis Malle ; writers, Louis Malle, Patrick Modiano ; photography, Tonino Delli Colli ; music, Django Reinhardt.
Cast: Pierre Blaise, Aurore Clement, Holger Lowenadler, Jean Bousquet.

results.title: La Peau et les Os = Skin and Bone
results.creator_credit: Jean-Paul Sassy, Rene Bezard and Rene Thevenet
results.brief_description:
While in prison, Jacques encounters the hostility of the other inmates who suspect him to be a snitch. A sudden reversal of situation gives him an opportunity to acquire both prestige and the trust of his companions. Ather this incident, inmates band together to help prove his innocence. Jacques finds himself free, without knowing to whom he owns his freedom. Awards: Prix Jean Vigo 1961.

Credits: Producers, Rene Bezard, Rene Thevenet; director, Jean-Paul Sassy ; writers, Jacques Panijel, Jean-Paul Sassy ; photography, Georges Leclerc ; music, Louiguy ; art direction, Sydney Bettex.
Cast: Gerard Blain, Juliette Mayniel, Andre Oumansky, Rene Dary, Julien Verdier, Etienne Bierry.

results.title: Passe Ton Bac D'abord = Graduate First
results.brief_description:
In a provincial city in the mining region of Northern France, a group of disillusioned students with no prospects other than dead-end jobs or unemployment, see little point in doing any work for their ‘baccalaureat’ (high school certificate). Ignoring the futile dissertations of their teachers, they drift aimlesslly round the local bistro or down the coast; some engage in hollow sexual encounters; others go to Paris. Pialat’s minutely detailed observation of dispossessed youth is made with an admirable combination of objectivity and compassion.

Credits: Producer, Maurice Pialat ; director, Maurice Pialat ; writer, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Pierre-William Glenn ; music, Patrick Juvet.
Cast: Sabine Haudepin, Philippe Marland, Valerie Chassigneux, Annick Alane, Michel Caron.

results.title: L'immortelle = the Immortal Woman
results.creator_credit: Alain Robbe-Grillet and Dino De Laurentiis
results.brief_description:
Andre and Leilah meet and become lovers. After a bizarre car accident, Leilah dies. Andre sets out to investigate Leilah’s death. Awards: Prix Louis-Delluc 1963.

Credits: Producer: Dino De Laurentiis ; director, Alain Robbe-Grillet ; writer, Alain Robbe-Grillet ; photography, Maurice Barry ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Jacques Doniol-Valcroze, Francoise Brion.
results.description:

results.title: Le Pactole = the Loot
results.brief_description:
A young couple pulls off a bank robbery only to be blackmailed by a witness, who turns out to be a corrupt police officer.

Credits: Producer, Roger Fleytoux ; director, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; writers, Patrick Granier, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; photography, Edmond Richard ; music, Roger Loubet.
Cast: Richard Bohringer, Patrick Sebastien, Pauline Lafont, Marie Laforet, Bernadette Lafont.

results.title: Vingt-quatre heures de la vie d'une femme = Twenty-four hours in a woman's life
results.brief_description:
Alice is a beautiful woman who lives in fear in ageing. During a holiday spent in an Italian casino town, she is seduced by Thomas, a much younger man with gambling debts and many secrets.

Credits: Director, Dominique Delouche ; writers, Marie-France Riviere, Dominique Delouche ; photography, Walter Wottitz ; music, Jean Prodromides.
Cast: Danielle Darrieux, Robert Hoffman, Marthe Alycia, Lena Skerla, Romina Power.

results.title: Empty Quarter
results.brief_description:
Set in Djibouti, this story is filmed in subjective camera style. An introspective, slightly self-absorbed journalist asks a French woman to share a room with him. He is attracted to her but is not sure how to go about making that point clear. They spend their time in banal conversation. After seeing an Australian movie (‘The man from Snowy River’) they decide to make their way across the desert to Alexandria.

Credits: Producers, Pascale Dauman, Francois Margolin ; director, Raymond Depardon ; writer, Raymond Depardon ; photography, Raymond Depardon.
Cast: Francoise Prenant.
